img.alt: Rhode Island Nurses Institute Middle College Charter High School

p.a: Rhode Island Nurses Institute Middle College Charter High School

div.p: The goal of RINIMC is to provide an early foundation in nursing education for high school students who have already chosen to pursue education and careers in nursing and health care.
Due to efforts to contain the COVID-19 virus, RINI Middle College will continue distance learning through at least the end of April.
div.h1: Educating the Nurses of Tomorrow, Today

hr.p: The mission of the Rhode Island Nurses Institute Middle College is to prepare a diverse group of students to become the highly educated and professional nursing workforce of the future.

article.p: Health care is the fastest growing industry in this country and most certainly in Rhode Island. The RI Department of Labor and Training forecasts that by 2024 our state will need over 4,000 nurses both, to replace nurses retiring, and to fill a growing need. At the same time, the perennial challenge of keeping high school students engaged and preparing them for these high demand careers remains challenging.

The Rhode Island Nurses Institute Middle College Charter High School, located in Providence, was created to solve these problems by offering an opportunity for RI students found nowhere else in this country. Founded in 2011, ours is the first charter school in the country dedicated to the nursing/ health care professions, and the first "middle college" to be created in Rhode Island.

Students who have completed 8th grade may apply for admittance to RINIMC. We are looking for dedicated and self-motivated students who are committed to a future in nursing. School days will be longer, summer study may be required, and the focus will be on producing college-level work. If this sounds exciting to you, then we want you in our school!
article.blockquote: "I am happy to send my child here because she is motivated to do well, and they assist her to excel not only in the classroom, but in personal aspects of her life". From Yvette J.

article.p: The Nurses Middle College students are afforded a rigorous high school curricula, early college classes, and exposure to the nursing profession. Students entering the 9th grade are allowed to enroll as first year students after successfully completing their 8th grade year at another school. Students who are successful in their first year take a combination of high school and college courses through URI, CCRI, RWU, and RIC during their third and fourth years.
article.blockquote: "Nothing is impossible the word itself says: I'm possible! I am happy that my daughter has achieved all her goals and taken advantage of all the opportunities that RINI offers. Very thankful that my daughter had the best teachers. RINI has been my family in good times and bad times". From Vivian M.

ul.li: Open to any Rhode Island high school student
4 year program college preparatory program of study, starting at the 9th grade
Students take college level courses at RI area colleges and universities
Saves students money on college tuition
Work-based learning experiences in health care
Certifications in First Aid, CPR, CNA (Certified Nursing Assistant), EMT (Emergency Medical Technician) and other patient care programs

div.blockquote: “We educate the next generation of nurses with a focus on academic rigor, leadership development, and workforce readiness.”
div.p: The Rhode Island Nurses Institute Middle College Charter High School, located in Providence, opened during the summer of 2011 to educate the next generation of nurses with a focus on academic rigor, leadership development, and workforce readiness. We are the first public charter high school in the U.S. focused on the profession of nursing and the first middle college in the State of RI. RI students for all school districts are welcome to apply.

Our vision is to create an innovative high school experience that is student-centric, structured to foster a supportive learning environment, and committed to developing the skills, knowledge, and passion necessary to excel in the nursing and allied health professions.
